page.title: 06Lytham Nature Reserve
page.content: The Lytham St. Annes Nature Reserve was established in July 1968. It was provided by the Lytham St.Annes Borough Council with the assistance of the Lancashire County Council and the Nature Conservancy. The Warden-Naturalist looks after the Reserve. He helps the general public and school parties to understand and enjoy the Reserve. The Reserve is completely open and an area rich in education. The Reserve is made up of a series of irregular hills and hollows.Thirty to forty years ago sand was dug out and sold for building.On top of the dunes Marram grass can be seen. After it has rained the peat under the dunes becomes waterlogged,Gulls rest and bathe in the freshwater.Water Crowfoot flowers can be seen in May.
